comment._content: Gunner James Orr, 317475. Born Bridgeton, Glasgow.

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content: 1/1st Home Counties (Kent) Heavy Battery RGA was a TF battery equipped with 60 pounder guns and went to France on 28th December 1915.//

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content: This photograph was probably taken by Alexander ('Alec') Roberts of the Piershill Studio, Edinburgh, where he worked from 1908-1933, before moving to new premises at The Old Post Office, Northfield Road.//

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content: James Orr appears to be the son of John, a Bricklayer, and Catherine Orr. He was born circa 1895 in Glasgow and had 5 siblings. The family lived at 3 Ann Street, Bridgeton, Glasgow at the time of the 1901 census.
